articles.title: WPK Delegation Meets Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
WPK Delegation Meets Raul Castro Ruz
 Havana, June 28 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, on a visit to Cuba met and had a friendly talk with Raul Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, at the building of the Council of State on June 27.
					 Raul Castro Ruz said Cuba will adhere to the principled stand in the relations with the DPRK to the end and that the friendly relations between the two countries provided by Fidel Castro Ruz and President Kim Il Sung will invariably grow stronger generation after generation.
					
					 Cuba will invariably defend socialism, he noted.
					
					 Present there were DPRK Ambassador to Cuba Pak Chang Yul, Jose Ramon Machado Ventura, second secretary of the C.C., the Communist Party of Cuba, Jose Ramon Balaguer, secretary of the Party Central Committee, and Oscar Martinez Cordoves, deputy head of the International Department of the Party Central Committee. 
					
					 The WPK delegation wound up its visit to Cuba and left Havana that day.

articles.title: Russian Media Persons Depart
articles.content:
Russian Media Persons Depart
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Byacheslav Goncharov, editor-in-chief of the Organ of the Maritime Territorial Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, and his party left here for home Monday.

articles.title: DPRK Taekwon-do Group Gives Performances in Russia
articles.content:
DPRK Taekwon-do Group Gives Performances in Russia
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- A Taekwon-do demonstration group of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee recently gave its performances in various regions of Russia.
					 After making its debut in Chelyabinsk, the group toured different cities of Moscow, Kaluga, Krasnodar Territory and other regions to show its demonstration performances.
					
					 Prior to the demonstrations, the flag of the DPRK was hoisted amid the playing of its national anthem in their venues. And the performers fully displayed their high skills to arouse great admiration from among the audience.
					
					 The group's recent Russia visit served as a significant occasion in widely disseminating the Taekwon-do, orthodox martial art of the Korean nation, and promoting the cultural exchange between the Korean and Russian peoples celebrating the year of DPRK-Russia friendship.

articles.title: Sports Contest for Pochonbo Torch Prize Closes
articles.content:
Sports Contest for Pochonbo Torch Prize Closes
 Nampho, June 29 (KCNA) -- The Sports Contest for Pochonbo Torch Prize closed with due ceremony at the Nampho Indoor Stadium on Monday. It opened on June 3.
					 The April 25 Sports Team came first in total points.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were officials concerned, sportspersons and working people.
					
					 Kim Pyong Sik, vice-minister of Physical Culture and Sports, made a closing address.

articles.title: Sports Facilities Snowballing
articles.content:
Sports Facilities Snowballing
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Sports facilities have been newly built or rebuilt in South Phyongan Province of the DPRK amid a great enthusiasm for sporting running high across the country.
					 A stadium and gymnasiums were built in Tokchon City, while sports facilities taking their shapes in Kaechon City and Maengsan, Mundok, Pukchang, Hoechang, Sinyang and Yangdok counties. And the construction of gymnasiums and swimming pools has been finished in many units like South Phyongan Provincial Information and Communication Center, the Power Distribution Station, Phyongsong University of Medicine and Kim Jong Suk Secondary School No. 1.
					
					 The province completed an indoor stadium and lodging quarters for sportspersons near Phyongsong Stadium and is pushing ahead with the remodeling of a gym for the Chongchongang Sports Team. 
					
					 Meanwhile, a fashionable indoor stadium is now under construction at the Sunchon Thermal Power Plant.

articles.title: Art Exhibition on Theme of Anti-Imperialist and Class Education Draws Lot of Visitors
articles.content:
Art Exhibition on Theme of Anti-Imperialist and Class Education Draws Lot of Visitors
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- An art exhibition on the theme of the anti-imperialist and class education is now under way at the Pyongyang International House of Culture on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The exhibition is visited every day by service personnel, working people, youth and students.
					
					 Displayed at its venue are art pieces dealing with the monstrous crimes committed by the U.S. and Japanese aggressors and class enemies.
					
					 Painting "Exhumers of Prince Nam Yon's Tomb" discloses the aggressive nature of the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 "Grudge-bearing Sinchon", "Demons" and "Sea in Flames and Sea of Blood" and other art pieces denounce the shuddering mass killings perpetrated by the enemies in the period of the strategic temporary retreat in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 Paintings help the visitors recall the crimes committed by the U.S. and Japanese imperialists and class enemies against the Korean people and teach a bitter lesson that any illusion about enemies precisely means death.
					
					 Also on display there are art pieces including "Rushing ahead to Destroy an Enemy Tank" and "Defenders of the Country."

articles.title: New Sheetlet Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Sheetlet Issued in DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea brought out a sheetlet showing slogan-bearing trees in the revolutionary battle site in Mt. Madu.
					 Seen in the upper part of the sheetlet are letters reading "Slogan-bearing trees in the revolutionary battle site in Mt. Madu" against the background of the site.
					
					 The stamps contained in the sheetlet show trees bearing such slogans as "Don't abandon revolutionary faith though one may die" and "Let's achieve the national liberation under the leadership of General Kim Il Sung", which reflected the indomitable spirit of the anti-Japanese revolutionary forerunners.
					
					 The revolutionary battle site in Mt. Madu was a secret base built in the area of Anju under the guidance of President Kim Il Sung during the anti-Japanese armed struggle. It served as a stronghold for regional leadership and military operations in the western part of Korea.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Accuses U.S. of Its Moves to Launch Nuclear War
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Accuses U.S. of Its Moves to Launch Nuclear War
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- The U.S. military moves to launch a nuclear war on the Korean peninsula at any cost have reached an ever more undisguised and full-fledged phase.
					 Recently, latest missile cruiser Chancellorsville of the U.S. Navy equipped with Aegis system anchored at the U.S. military base in Yokosuka, Japan.
					
					 Belonging to carrier flotilla, it has the mission to strike naval and underwater targets while performing missile defense and anti-air defense duties. Military experts are unanimous in commenting that it is the first time for the U.S. to deploy overseas the warship with such striking-capability.
					
					 Two cruisers equipped with similar missile defense system will be deployed in Yokosuka late in 2017.
					
					 If the above-said warships are deployed, the number of the warships in the U.S. Navy base in Yokosuka will reach 14 including the U.S. nuclear carrier Ronald Reagan to be deployed at the end of this year, the appearance of the largest-ever warship fleet in Japan since World War II, foreign press reports said.
					
					 As regards the deployment of three warships equipped with Aegis system, the U.S. Navy base command in Yokosuka claimed it is part of the U.S. "strategy for making a switchover to Asia-Pacific" in a bid to "contain" the DPRK and China.
					
					 It was also reported that the U.S. is mulling temporarily deploying four Global Hawks at the Misawa airfield of Japan from July.
					
					 All these military moves under the pretext of "containing the DPRK and China" are aimed to kick up an overall nuclear war racket against the DPRK in the ground, air and seas.
					
					 This fully revealed once again the aggressive nature of the U.S. imperialists who are making no scruple of periodically disturbing peace and stability in the region to attain their strategic and avaricious purposes.
					
					 Through a statement of the National Defence Commission the DPRK declared before the whole world that its army and people would launch a nationwide action of a new high level against the robber-like U.S. imperialists.
					
					 As clarified in the statement, the frantic moves the U.S. has stepped up for a nuclear war by introducing Chancellorsville, Global Hawk and the like would face stronger counter-actions of the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to bear in mind that the DPRK has already put in place powerful strike group equipped with strategic and tactical rockets to cope with its missile threat.
					
					 The U.S. is required to pay heed to the DPRK's warning that it is ready for conventional or nuclear or cyber wars.
					
					 The world people still remember and will never forget such crime committed by the U.S. against humanity 70 years ago as dropping atomic bombs over Hiroshima and Nagasaki to achieve its strategic aim.
					
					 It is a serious miscalculation and daydream for the U.S. to think it can employ the same method on the Korean peninsula as what it did to attain its purpose.
					
					 It is as clear as a pikestaff that if the U.S. nuclear maniacs ignite a nuclear war on the peninsula at any cost, they will perish in the flames kindled by themselves.
					
					 After all, the U.S. styling itself "the world's only superpower" will precipitate its final ruin.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Puppet Forces' "Sanctions" Racket against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Puppet Forces' "Sanctions" Racket against DPRK 
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- As was disclosed, the south Korean authorities made public "financial sanctions against the north" on June 26, listing "institutions and individuals assisting the north." They are describing this as a measure for "stronger pressure upon the north" to "lead it to changes."
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 Their "sanctions" racket glaringly reveals the reckless efforts of Park Geun Hye and her cohorts to escalate the confrontation.
					
					 It is ridiculous for them to talk about "sanctions" as they can hardly exist without the backing of the U.S. But what is more foolish is their attempt to pressurize the north with a petty amount of money in a bid to lead it to dialogue. 
					
					 The aspiration of all Koreans and the DPRK's efforts to improve the inter-Korean relations are facing a blatant challenge owing to their "sanctions" racket against the DPRK. This grave situation patently proves what the Park group is after.
					
					 The Park group is making desperate efforts to get rid of the abyss of its ruling crisis into which it is finding itself owing to the deteriorated inter-Korean relations, but this can never be a way out.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK are highly alerted to deal merciless retaliatory blows at the puppet forces getting so reckless while talking about "sanctions", "pressure" and "preemptive attack".
					
					 Their "sanctions" racket would only bring them to the cemetery of history.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Demands S. Korean Authorities Give up Ambition for "Unification of Social Systems"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Demands S. Korean Authorities Give up Ambition for "Unification of Social Systems"
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- In order to put an end to distrust and confrontation between the north and the south the south Korean authorities should give up, among other things, their ambition for achieving the "unification of the social systems, their root cause, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article.
					  It goes on:
					
					 Under the situation where there exist differing ideologies and social systems in the north and the south, the unification by one social system will only spark confrontation and war.
					
					 The "unification of social systems" touted by the south Korean puppet forces is an unpardonable act of treachery as it tramples down the aspiration and desire of the compatriots for the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea.
					
					 More than half a century has passed since differing ideologies and social systems came to exist in the north and the south. No one is willing to abandon his ideology and social system. Therefore, if one side considers its ideology and social system as absolute and forces it on the other side, the two sides cannot escape confrontation.
					
					 In order to achieve the country's reunification peacefully, they should not deny the ideology and social system of the other side but go in the direction of establishing a federal formula on the basis of recognizing them.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces have persistently pursued treacherous "unification of social systems" in disregard of the DPRK's sincere efforts. This is an unpardonable act of treachery as it brings the disaster of a war to this land. 
					
					 It is the criminal scenario of the south Korean puppet forces to intensify their anti-DPRK "human rights" campaign in league with outside forces in a bid to tarnish the image of the dignified DPRK, break the single-minded unity of its service personnel and people and, furthermore, achieve the "unification of social systems." 
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that the inter-Korean relations are bound to totally collapse due to the south Korean authorities' desperate moves to malignantly hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and its social system and achieve "unification of social systems." 
					
					 They would be well advised to give up their foolish ambition for achieving "unification of social systems" and make a policy switchover.

articles.title: Victims of Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army in S. Korea Call for Legal Action
articles.content:
Victims of Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army in S. Korea Call for Legal Action
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- South Korean victims of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army held a press conference in Kwangju City, Kyonggi Province on June 23, calling for a legal action to pressurize Japan to settle its past crimes.
					 At the conference, speakers accused the Japanese government of distorting the truth of history and insulting victims despite the fact that the victims are suffering pain still now.
					
					 They clarified they would file a suit in a court against Japanese enterprises recorded with war crimes including Mitsubishi Heavy Industry, the present prime minister and conservative media which insulted the victims of the sexual slavery as prostitutes.
					
					 It is essential to force the Japanese authorities to make a sincere apology, they said.
					
					 More than 40 civic organizations including the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea held an urgent press conference outside the Japanese embassy in Seoul on the same day to denounce the Japanese government for working hard to hush up the past crimes.

articles.title: Korean Photo, Book and Art Exhibitions Opened in Russia
articles.content:
Korean Photo, Book and Art Exhibitions Opened in Russia
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Korean photo, book and art exhibitions were opened in Ulan-Ude City and at the DPRK Center of the Far East State Science Library, Russia on June 15 and 18 on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 On display at the venues of the exhibitions were photos dealing with the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were their works, photos and books introducing Songun Korea and art pieces showing the talents of the Korean people.
					
					 The minister of Culture of the Republic of Buryatia said that he would further strengthen the exchange and cooperation with the DPRK in all fields in the future.
					
					 The chairman of the Cultural Committee of the Ulan-Ude City Administration said the DPRK exhibitions always have good influence upon our citizens and that they are admiring the wisdom and talents of the Korean people after looking round the exhibitions.
					
					 The vice-minister of Education and Science of the Khabarovsk Territory Administration said that Kim Jong Il who made a great contribution to the development of the Russia-DPRK friendship was the great leader being highly praised by the Russian people.
					
					 He stressed that the exhibition would make a positive contribution to the development of the friendly relations between the two countries and peoples.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Spain
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Spain
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party" was brought out in booklet by the Anfer Publishing House in Spain on June 15.
					 The work, published on April 6, Juche 101 (2012), says that it is the principled requirement for victoriously advancing the Korean revolutionary cause to hold leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					
					 It indicates tasks to be fulfilled to steadily develop the WPK into the glorious party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in France
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in France
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering President Kim Il Sung was formed in France on June 23.
					 Guy Dupre, president of the France-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize diverse political and cultural events on the occasion of the 21st anniversary of demise of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Works Studied in UK, Germany
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Works Studied in UK, Germany
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- Seminars on leader Kim Jong Il's works were held in the UK and Germany on June 17 and 18 on the 51st anniversary of his start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK). 
					 His work "Giving Priority to Ideological Work Is Essential for Accomplishing Socialism" was studied in the UK while his work "Look after the People in a Responsible Manner As a Mother Would Do with Her Children" in Germany.
					
					 Present there were personages of the New Communist Party of Britain, the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany and masses.
					
					 There were briefings on the works to be followed by speeches.
					
					 Andy Brooks, general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party of Britain, and other speakers said that Kim Jong Il authored lots of works which would serve as important guidelines for building a revolutionary party and its activities and developed the WPK into an invincible party. 
					
					 The chairman of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany said under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il the Korean people have become the most fortunate people leading a worthy life and the WPK could demonstrate its dignity as a genuine popular party that formed a kinship with the popular masses and always finds itself among them.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Marshal Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar held in the UK.

articles.title: WPK Birthday to Be Marked in Germany
articles.content:
WPK Birthday to Be Marked in Germany
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of the Communist Party of Germany for celebrating the 70th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) was inaugurated on June 22.
					 Torsten Schoevitz, chairman of the Communist Party of Germany, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to give wide publicity to the glorious history of the WPK and arrange colorful political and cultural events on the occasion of the anniversary. It also decided to send a delegation to the DPRK.

articles.title: U.S. Scenario of Germ Warfare Denounced by French Organization
articles.content:
U.S. Scenario of Germ Warfare Denounced by French Organization
 Pyongyang, June 29 (KCNA) -- The France-Korea Friendship Association posted on its website an article disclosing the U.S. scenario for germ warfare against the DPRK on June 5.
					 The article said:
					
					 Recently raised again is an issue of revising a pact on the status of the U.S. forces in south Korea which are exercising extraterritorial rights with the disclosure of the Pentagon's secret introduction of extremely dangerous anthrax germs into south Korea as an occasion.
					
					 It is not the first time that the U.S. introduced and used the weapons of mass destruction on the land of Korea.
					
					 The U.S. already used biochemical weapons during the 1950-1953 Korean war.
					
					 It has introduced and deployed a lot of nuclear warheads in the south of the Korean peninsula since the 1950s.
					
					 However, the International Atomic Energy Agency has found fault with the DPRK over its nuclear program only.
					
					 The U.S. forces in south Korea are, without doubt, possessors and users of huge weapons of mass destruction.

articles.title: Delegacion de PTC se reune con Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Delegacion de PTC se reune con Raul Castro Ruz
La Habana, 28 de junio (ACNC) -- La delegacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea encabezada por Kang Sok Ju, miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del PTC, de visita en Cuba, departio el dia 27 en un ambiente amistoso en la sede del Consejo de Estado con Raul Castro Ruz, Primer Secretario del CC del Partido Comunista de Cuba y Presidente de los Consejos de Estado y de Ministros de la Republica de Cuba.
					El mandatario cubano dijo que Cuba mantendra hasta el fin la posicion de principios en las relaciones con la RPDC y subrayo que las relaciones de amistad entre ambos paises, preparadas por los companeros Fidel Castro Ruz y Kim Il Sung, se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran de generacion en generacion.
					
					Y subrayo que Cuba mantendra invariablemente el socialismo.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el embajador coreano acreditado en Cuba, Pak Chang Yul, el segundo secretario del CC del PCC, Jose Ramon Machado Ventura, el secretario del CC del PCC, Jose Ramon Balaguer, y el subjefe del departamento internacional del CC del PCC, Oscar Martinez Cordoves.
					
					Ese dia, la delegacion del PTC partio de La Habana tras terminar la visita a Cuba.

articles.title: Cuerpo modelo de Taekwondo presenta demostracion en Rusia
articles.content:
Cuerpo modelo de Taekwondo presenta demostracion en Rusia
Pyongyang, 29 de junio (ACNC) -- El cuerpo modelo del Comite de Taekwondo de Corea presento su demostracion en varias ciudades rusas arrancando efusivas ovaciones de los espectadores.
					   El cuerpo se estreno en Chelyabinsk, y realizo seguidamente su demostracion en Moscu, Kaluga, el territorio litoral de Krasnodar, etc., dejando gran impresion a los espectadores.
					
					   Antes de inicio de actos, se izo la bandera nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y se escucho solemnemente el himno nacional de esta.
					
					   Los taekwondocas cumplieron con habilidad diversos movimientos de alta tecnologia.
					
					   La demostracion del cuerpo modelo de Taekwondo sirvio de un motivo para divulgar ampliamente este arte marcial tipico de la nacion coreana y desarrollar el intercambio cultural entre los pueblos de ambos paises que acogen el ano de amistad Corea-Rusia.
